comments.body: Looks like you mention the inherited widget here but it doesn't exist. Add it and update references in the file above
Nit: make order match the order the properties are declared in (and referenced in copyWith, hash, etc) all be consistent.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +33,37 @@  /// Creates a theme that can be used for [ThemeData.BottomNavigationBarTheme].
  const BottomNavigationBarThemeData({
    this.backgroundColor,
    this.elevation,
    this.selectedIconTheme,

comments.body: This approach does mesh nicely with the existing widget API. However what about hover/focused/disabled colors? Shouldn't we use MaterialStateProperty<IconThemeData> here? Etc.

We talked about this offline, it does make sense for the `BottomNavigationBar` to resolve these values if they are `MaterialStateProperty`s, similar to how raw material button does. Doing this can be done retroactively though, and I'd prefer not to do it as part of this change.
Can they? Shouldn't we allow ThemeData.bottomNavigationBarTheme to be null (by default)?

The pattern we have used thus far is to have the `fooTheme` properties on `ThemeData` default to non-null `FooThemeData` objects, with all `null` properties. 

https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/bec63a54bfad422c2a175a1d73052e67cc9785a9/packages/flutter/lib/src/material/theme_data.dart#L356
